isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION

svcproc.title: Air Suspension With Air or Hydraulic Brakes
svcproc.para: When key switch (24) is moved to ignition or start position, power is fed to circuit 13F, fuse F30, and circuit 61 to the air suspension solenoid (231). Ground is through circuit 61-G to (2G) grounding stud.

On units with hydraulic brakes, power is also fed from fuse F30 to circuit 40B and the low air pressure alarm (117). When the air pressure is low, the low air pressure switch (230) is closed. The ground circuit is completed for the alarm with circuits 40-GB and 61-GA, and for the warning light with circuits 40-GC, 40-GB, and 61-GA.
